Body:
Lit., "for the safeguarding of the Quraysh", i.e., as the
				custodians of the Ka'bah and the tribe in the midst of
				which the Last Prophet, Muhammad, was to appear. Thus,
				the "security of the Quraysh" is a metonym for the
				security of the Ka'bah, the focal point of the Faith
				based on the concept of God's oneness, for the sake of
				which the army of Abrahah was destroyed (see introductory
				note as well as preceding surah).
I.e., the two annual trade caravans - to the Yemen in\n\t\t\t\twinter and to Syria in summer - on which the prosperity\n\t\t\t\tof Mecca depended.
Cf. Abraham's prayer, "O my Sustainer! Make this a land\n\t\t\t\tsecure, and grant its people fruitful sustenance"\n\t\t\t\t 2:126 .
